info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 11 at 3:16PM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 14 inches possible. Highest amounts above 1000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 80 mph. * WHERE...In Oregon, Western Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, Western Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be extremely difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage and power outages. Bitter cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The range of potential snow amounts has increased due to uncertainty regarding the exact track of the surface low responsible for the potential winter storm. There is now a 25% chance snow amounts wind up as low as 1 to 2 inches, and a 25% chance snow amounts wind up around 1 foot or more. Be sure to monitor the forecast closely for potential changes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
